newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore business holding back Cambodia investment.
newsitem.headline: Singapore business holding back Cambodia investment.

text.p: Singapore business is holding back investment in Cambodia, Trade and Industry Minister Lee Yock Suan was quoted on Monday as saying.
The Straits Times daily newspaper said on Monday that Lee had told Singapore reporters on Sunday: "Investors are holding back. So we hope the situation will return to normal very soon."
Singapore business people should think in the long term instead of trying to get quick returns if they wanted to put money in Cambodia, Lee was quoted as saying.
Singapore companies have invested more than Singapore $431 million (US$299 million) in Cambodia.
Separately, the Straits Times reported that Singapore has suspended mail service to Cambodia until further notice.

Cambodia has seen violent conflict since Second Prime Minister Hun Sen launched a violent coup in the capital Phnom Penh a little over a week ago to wrest power away from Second Prime Minister Prince Norodom Ranariddh.
